definitions.definition: A two-dimensional labeled data structure with columns of potentially different types, similar to a spreadsheet or SQL table.
A popular Python library for creating visualizations.
A Python library for numerical computing.
A Python library for data manipulation and analysis.
A one-dimensional labeled array capable of holding any data type.

concepts.name: Data Cleaning
concepts.explanation: Handling missing or duplicate data, data normalization, and data type conversion to prepare data for analysis.

concepts.name: Data Ingestion
concepts.explanation: The process of reading and writing data from various file formats such as CSV, Excel, SQL databases, and more.

concepts.name: Data Manipulation
concepts.explanation: Filtering, sorting, grouping, and aggregating data to extract insights and meaning.

concepts.name: Data Visualization
concepts.explanation: Creating insightful visualizations using libraries like Matplotlib and Seaborn to communicate findings effectively.

concepts.name: Data Visualization Requirements
concepts.explanation: Different types of data and visualization requirements that can be catered to using Matplotlib's plotting functions.

concepts.name: DataFrame
concepts.explanation: A two-dimensional labeled data structure with columns of potentially different types, similar to a spreadsheet or SQL table.

concepts.name: Plot Types and Customization Options
concepts.explanation: Range of plot types and customization options available in Matplotlib for various data visualization needs.

concepts.name: Series
concepts.explanation: A one-dimensional labeled array capable of holding any data type.

concepts.name: Static, Interactive, and Animated Visualizations
concepts.explanation: Types of visualizations that can be created using Matplotlib

concepts.name: Time Series Analysis
concepts.explanation: Specialized tools for working with time series data, including date/time indexing and frequency conversion.
